text.p: HSBC James Capel said on Monday it raised its rating on the shares of PacifiCorp to a long-term buy from neutral, based on the company's proposed acquisition of Britain's Energy Group Plc.
-- PacifiCorp agreed on Friday to buy Energy Group for $9.6 billion in a deal that would create one of the world's biggest energy companies.
-- Analyst Daniel Ford said in a research note the acquisition would be 20 percent accretive to earnings in both 1998 and 1999 under the reasonable financing options.
-- Ford said an acquisition would combine two highly competitive electricity generators that seemed to have common visions for exploiting opportunities in global energy markets.
-- His 18-month valuation suggested a $25 per share price target, Ford said.
